org.threadly.concurrent

Class TaskExecutorDistributor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.TaskExecutorDistributor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TaskSchedulerDistributor

    public class TaskExecutorDistributor
extends java.lang.Object

    TaskDistributor is designed to take a multi-threaded pool and add tasks with a given key such that those tasks will be run single threaded for any given key. The thread which runs those tasks may be different each time, but no two tasks with the same key will ever be run in parallel.

    Because of that, it is recommended that the executor provided has as many possible threads as possible keys that could be provided to be run in parallel. If this class is starved for threads some keys may continue to process new tasks, while other keys could be starved.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16. This also does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).
        Parameters:
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                       boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16.
        Parameters:
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                       int maxTasksPerCycle)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16. This also does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).
        Parameters:
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                       int maxTasksPerCycle,
                       boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used. This constructs with a default expected level of concurrency of 16.
        Parameters:
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate

        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(int expectedParallism,
                       java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                       int maxTasksPerCycle)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This constructor does not attempt to have an accurate queue size for the "getTaskQueueSize" call (thus preferring high performance).
        Parameters:
        expectedParallism - level of expected qty of threads adding tasks in parallel
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys

      • TaskExecutorDistributor

        public TaskExecutorDistributor(int expectedParallism,
                       java.util.concurrent.Executor executor,
                       int maxTasksPerCycle,
                       boolean accurateQueueSize)
        Constructor to use a provided executor implementation for running tasks. This constructor allows you to provide a maximum number of tasks for a key before it yields to another key. This can make it more fair, and make it so no single key can starve other keys from running. The lower this is set however, the less efficient it becomes in part because it has to give up the thread and get it again, but also because it must copy the subset of the task queue which it can run. This also allows you to specify if you want accurate queue sizes to be tracked for given thread keys. There is a performance hit associated with this, so this should only be enabled if "getTaskQueueSize" calls will be used.
        Parameters:
        expectedParallism - level of expected qty of threads adding tasks in parallel
        executor - A multi-threaded executor to distribute tasks to. Ideally has as many possible threads as keys that will be used in parallel.
        maxTasksPerCycle - maximum tasks run per key before yielding for other keys
        accurateQueueSize - true to make "getTaskQueueSize" more accurate

      • getExecutor

        Returns:
        executor tasks are being distributed to

      • getSubmitterForKey

        public SubmitterExecutorInterface getSubmitterForKey(java.lang.Object threadKey)
        Returns a SubmitterExecutorInterface implementation where all tasks submitted on this executor will run on the provided key.
        Parameters:
        threadKey - object key where hashCode will be used to determine execution thread
        Returns:
        executor which will only execute based on the provided key

      • getTaskQueueSize

        public int getTaskQueueSize(java.lang.Object threadKey)
        Call to check how many tasks have been queued up for a given key. Depending on what constructor was used, and if a true was passed in for "accurateQueueSize", the accuracy of this call varies dramatically. If true was not supplied in the constructor for "accurateQueueSize", this will only report how many tasks have not been accepted by the worker yet. The accepting of those tasks occur in batches, so this number will varry dramatically (and probably be unusable). So it is highly recommended that if your interested in this functionality you supply a true into the constructor. Supplying a true for "accurateQueueSize" in the constructor does involve some performance cost, but that overhead should be minimal (just no reason to accept any loss if not interested in this feature).
        Parameters:
        threadKey - key for task queue to examine
        Returns:
        the number of tasks queued for the key
        Since:
        1.2.0

           java.lang.Runnable task)

      • submitTask

        public <T> ListenableFuture<T> submitTask(java.lang.Object threadKey,
                                 java.lang.Runnable task,
                                 T result)
        Submit a task to be run with a given thread key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of result returned from the future
        Parameters:
        threadKey - object key where hashCode will be used to determine execution thread
        task - Runnable to be executed
        result - Result to be returned from future when task completes
        Returns:
        Future to represent when the execution has occurred and provide the given result
